methods.forEach:
Starting from the next iterator position (if any), feed values to the consumer until it returns false. After each
 value is consumed, the current iterator position is moving forward; eg, a call to forEach that consumes 4
 elements effectively works as if next was called 4 times.

:param sc: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.impl.rsp.container.ShortConsumer) - a ShortConsumer to feed values to.
:return: (boolean) false if the processing was stopped by the consumer returning false, true otherwise.
methods.hasNext:
Whether the underlying container is exhausted or not

:return: (boolean) true if there is data remaining
methods.next:
Writes to buffer the next batch of values, and returns how much of the buffer was used.

:param buffer: (short[]) - the buffer to write values onto.
:param offset: (int) - first position to start writing in buffer.
:param maxCount: (int) - max number of elements to write to buffer.
:return: (int) how many values were written.
